Articles.Content: I've seen several screen captures with a graphical orbit display and other data. How do I get that to pop up?

There are several applications that will help you calculate orbits by punching in velocity and apogee / perigee information. They will also display images of your orbit. There is nothing in the game yet that lets you display what orbit you're in. 

I use a java app called KSPCalculator. You can find it here on the forums [http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=562](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=562). There are HTML calculators as well.

^This

However I believe there may be official calcs. in future releases, so you dotn have two windows open.

OP might be referring to the mockup UI that's been posted here, with the navball on the left and the orbit display on the right.

If so, you don't get it to pop up - it's just a suggested layout for a future panel.
